titleStmt.title: Gabriel J. Endicutt to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5404

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: The petitioner Gabriel J Endicutt, the father of Gabriel Endicutt a prisoner in the penitentiary, respectfully, petitions for The pardon of his son, upon the papers accompanying this. Petition lives in Kansas, has a family, is of limited means, and exposed to all the troubles and dangers of frontier life. His son had borne always, an excellent character had never before had a quarrel was industrious and obedient is now but 27 years old, and under age when the occurence took place out of which grew his conviction and if pardoned will go to Kansas to remain.

Respectfully
Gabriel J Endicutt ^his X mark^
Witness Jas Harlan Jr
Lawrence Cir Ct
Gabriel Endicutt
